titlestmt.titleproper: Register of the John A. Dolan papers
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Alexandra Kelly

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2016-07-08T15:15-0700
profiledesc.langusage: Finding aid is written in English

did.abstract: Correspondence, memoranda, reports, and minutes relating to Allied administration of occupied territories, relief operations, labor relations, enforcement of laws and ordinances, and complaints made against Allied occupation troops in the Rhineland.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], John A. Dolan papers, [Box number], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1956.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the library catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: John A. Dolan supervised the Child Feeding Relief Efforts in Germany following World War I. He continued his stay in Koblenz, occupying the position of District Executive for the American Department of the Inter-Allied Rhineland High Commission from 1920 to 1922, at which time the operations were transferred from the Americans to the French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: The John A. Dolan papers are comprised of printed matter, correspondence, personnel papers, meeting minutes, reports, and ordinances regarding the post-World War I Inter-Allied Rhineland High Commission. The commission was established to assist post-war Germany in its recovery and to supervise the activies of the country.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The American Friends Service Committee began its work in the early 1920s and worked to feed hundreds of German children in various cities following World War I. The series is comprised of correspondence, memoranda and statistical reports relating to the committee's relief work.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The Board of Conciliation was appointed by the Inter-Allied Rhineland High Commission to arbitrate disputes. The series is composed of meeting minutes, correspondence, and reports.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence discussing official business, occupied territories, drivers licenses, and thanks for service. Correspondants include: John A. Dolan, the German Commissioner for the Occupied Rhineland Territories, the President of the Inter-allied Rhineland High Commission, the Secretary of State, Dr. Brandt, and Henry T. Allen.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Financial information pertaining to the aftermath of World War I, including costs of war, reparations determined at the Paris Conference and the Cannes Conference, fluctuations of the German mark, and costs of the Inter-Allied Rhineland High Commission.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains meeting minutes, correspondence, memoranda, reports, and draft ordinances.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Discussing issues such as strikes, distribution of materials, and wages.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Documents about Inter-Allied Rhineland High Commission employees, including recommendation letters, thanks for service, short biographies, statements of grief, and an address to the Graduating Class of General and Commercial School A.F.G.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes brief descriptions of the Commission and its purposes, explanations of representative duties, monthly reports, and information regarding the ongoings of occupied territories.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes correspondence and map regarding the A.R.A - US Navy communcation system in Europe.
